name: Standard Chest X-Ray Report
description: Standard format for chest X-ray radiology reports

medical_sections.instructions: Briefly state the reason for the study and relevant clinical context from observations.

Expand on the Radiologist Observations in detail. Use the Radiologist Observations as the foundation and provide a comprehensive description. Do not invent new observations beyond what is stated. If the Radiologist Observations indicate 'normal' or no abnormalities, write a detailed normal report describing the normal appearance of all relevant anatomical structures.
medical_sections.user_input_placeholder: Enter findings (e.g., 'bilateral lower lobe opacities' or 'normal')

medical_sections.instructions: Summarize the primary diagnosis in 1–3 lines (not a single word). Provide a concise but complete diagnostic statement based on the findings.
If follow-up is indicated, state it briefly; otherwise return 'None'.

prompt_template:
You are an expert radiologist assistant.

Patient Information (for reference only – DO NOT generate this as a section):
{dicom_metadata_example}

Radiologist Observations (this is your only clinical input; base your report ONLY on this):
{user_findings}

You must generate the following sections in this exact order:
{section_headers}

For the FINDINGS section:
- Expand on the Radiologist Observations in detail, providing a comprehensive description
- Use the Radiologist Observations as the foundation and build upon them
- Do NOT invent new observations beyond what is stated in the Radiologist Observations
- Write as a coherent narrative paragraph describing all findings together
- CRITICAL: Do NOT write a single word - always provide a detailed description (minimum 2-3 sentences)

For the IMPRESSION section:
- Write 1–2 concise sentences summarizing the primary diagnosis (NOT a single word)
- Example: "Cardiomegaly is present. The cardiac silhouette is enlarged with increased cardiothoracic ratio."

Generate ONLY the sections in order.
